body_html:
@colesbury
There's two models that are being called in the Model class. One is the ResNet and the other is https://github.com/amdegroot/ssd.pytorch.

I ran your code and it works fine - no mem leak. I also modified your repo to include ssd.pytorch and it worked fine. So the memory leak must be an error on my part. Weird that it doesn't happen with the latest released version of pytorch though.

Let me track it down and then i'll test for the segfault.

body:
@colesbury 
There's two models that are being called in the `Model` class. One is the ResNet and the other is https://github.com/amdegroot/ssd.pytorch.

I ran your code and it works fine - no mem leak. I also modified your repo to include ssd.pytorch and it worked fine. So the memory leak must be an error on my part. Weird that it doesn't happen with the latest released version of pytorch though. 

Let me track it down and then i'll test for the segfault.
